title: 103_s505
content:
The "Food Stamp Anti-Fraud Act of 1993" is the short title of this Act. It pertains to the use of application information by retail food stores and wholesale food concerns. Section 9(c) of the Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to designate sentences as paragraphs and subparagraphs, allowing officers or employees of law enforcement agencies to administer and enforce the Act and its regulations. The Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to allow officers or employees to enforce the Act. Unauthorized disclosure of information obtained under this authority is subject to legal consequences under title 18, United States Code. The Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to increase penalties for trafficking in food stamps and trading firearms, ammunition, explosives, or controlled substances for food stamps. Additionally, the use of taxpayer identification numbers is addressed. The Social Security Act is amended to include provisions for the administration and enforcement of the Act by Federal or State law enforcement agencies. The Social Security Act is amended to allow access to employer identification numbers by Federal or State law enforcement agencies for the administration or enforcement of the Act or any other Federal or State law. The Social Security Act is amended to allow access to employer identification numbers by Federal or State law enforcement agencies for the administration or enforcement of the Act or any other Federal or State law. This includes officers and employees of law enforcement or investigative agencies with duties requiring access for enforcement purposes. TITLE II--MISCELLANEOUS

SEC. 201. PERMANENT DISQUALIFICATION OF RECIPIENTS FOR TRADING FIREARMS, AMMUNITION, EXPLOSIVES, OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES FOR FOOD STAMPS.

Amends the Food Stamp Act of 1977 to permanently disqualify recipients upon the third occasion of trading firearms, ammunition, explosives, or controlled substances for food stamps.

SEC. 202. USE OF PENALTIES COLLECTED FROM RETAIL FOOD STORES AND WHOLESALE FOOD CONCERNS. Section 18 of the Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to allocate funds collected from claims against retail food stores or wholesale food concerns for investigation and enforcement activities under the Act. The amendments made by this Act will be effective within 120 days of final regulations issued by the Secretary of Agriculture, with exceptions for sections 102, 103, and 202 which will be effective upon enactment.
